intro: Werauhia verrucosa, commonly known as the velvet leaf. It is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. It produces striking, showy inflorescences that are typically yellow or orange in color. Werauhia verrucosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in humid environments.
